Invoking: `validate` with `{'patch': '--- a/src/objects/intl-objects.cc\n+++ b/src/objects/intl-objects.cc\n@@ -452,7 +452,10 @@\n   icu::Locale icu_locale = icu::Locale::forLanguageTag(bcp47_locale, status);\n-  DCHECK(U_SUCCESS(status));\n+  if (!U_SUCCESS(status)) {\n+    return Nothing<icu::Locale>();\n+  }\n   if (icu_locale.isBogus()) {\n     return Nothing<icu::Locale>();\n   }\n'}`
responded: The fatal error is at line 453 of `src/objects/intl-objects.cc`:
```cpp
453|   DCHECK(U_SUCCESS(status));
```
This asserts ICU locale creation succeeded, but in a release/non-debug build, ICC may continue, and the failing status could cause a null/bogus ICU locale, as well as propagate errors later.

**Within `CreateICULocale`:**
- If `U_SUCCESS(status)` fails, icu_locale may be bogus, and later code will either fail silently or with unhelpful errors.
- In `ResolveLocale` (line 2454), the call to `CreateICULocale` is wrapped with `MAYBE_RETURN`, which will return `Nothing` if it fails.

### Safest Fix
- Instead of crashing with `DCHECK(U_SUCCESS(status))`, return `Nothing<icu::Locale>()` if ICU reports an error.

Let’s proceed to patch this.
